page.title: 08Matching Tye Village Hall
page.content:
The first{Women's Institute}in Matching was formed in 1919. The WI paid for and built the{Village Hall}in 1922.
In 1934 the hall was handed over to {Trusties.}The hall was officially handed over to the village in 1963. Now it is run by the{Village Hall {Committee.
To hire the hall you have to pay. The rent is Â£60 per day or Â£38 per evening.{The WI pays a cheaper rent.
The weekly uses are:- Monday afternoon,{Friendly Club;}Tuesday afternoon,{keep fit;}Wednesday evening,{Cubs;}Thursday evening,{keep {fit;}Saturdays,{weddings and discos. {The WI}meets there every second Wednesday in each month.
